arts.ttl: Bayer Leverkusen plan to steal Bayern Munich jewel Paul Wanner
arts.sum: According to Florian Plettenberg, Bayer Leverkusen are looking to prize Paul Wanner away from Bayern Munich in the summer. The 18-year-old is currently on loan at Heidenheim, where he has…

arts.ttl: Frank Schmidt's tactical tweaks guide Heidenheim past Hearts
arts.sum: Frank Schmidt's side made the trip to the Scottish capital for a meeting with Hearts on Matchday 3 of the Conference League this evening. Goals from Sirlord Conteh and Jan Schöppner ensured a 2-0 win in Scotland.

arts.ttl: Neil Critchley believes Hearts for unfortunate to get beaten by Heidenheim
arts.sum: Sirlord Conteh and Jan Schoppner hit the goals.

arts.ttl: Neil Critchley believes Hearts for unfortunate to get beaten by Heidenheim
arts.sum: Sirlord Conteh and Jan Schoppner hit the goals.

arts.ttl: Neil Critchley disappointed with Hearts result but not performance as boss tells troops 'let's go again' with Rangers up next
arts.sum: Heidenheim left Tynecastle with a 2-0 win to end the Jambos' 100 per cent record - and maintain their own.

arts.ttl: Lawrence Shankland shoulders Hearts blame and admits 'it's not happening for me'
arts.sum: Overall the performance was good, we created enough chances for myself. Gutted Lawrence Shankland shouldered the blame as Hearts were left to rue missed chances against Heidenheim.

arts.ttl: Hearts’ unbeaten Conference League run comes to end after defeat to Heidenheim
arts.sum: Sirlord Conteh and substitute Jan Schoppner were on target.

arts.ttl: Hearts left to rue missed chances as perfect record gone after Bundesliga rookies step up a gear - 3 talking points
arts.sum: Neil Critchley's side dominated the first half and got punished for missing a hatful of big chances at Tynecastle

arts.ttl: Germany or Austria? Paul Wanner rejects senior Germany call-up
arts.sum: According to Süddeutsche Zeitung, Paul Wanner has rejected a senior call-up for Germany, leaving his international career in the balance. Soon he must choose between representing Germany and Austria. Wanner…
